intro: Scleria distans var. distans, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and a dense cluster of small, spike-like flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in regions with high humidity and saturated soils. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in swampy areas or along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
